name: SBI Clerk (Junior Associates)
description: A highly competitive national-level examination conducted by the State Bank of India (SBI) for the recruitment of Junior Associates (Customer Support & Sales). This is a clerical cadre post in various branches of SBI across the country.

eligibility.ageLimit: Between 20 and 28 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (OBC, SC/ST, PwBD, etc.) as per government norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Graduation in any discipline from a recognised University or any equivalent qualification. Final year students are also eligible to apply provisionally. Proficiency (reading, writing, speaking, and understanding) in the specified opted local language is required.
eligibility.numberOfAttempts: There are restrictions on the number of attempts for the SBI Clerk exam. For the General/EWS category, it is 4. Relaxations are available for other categories.

timeline.notificationDate: November 16, 2023 (for the 2023-24 cycle). The exam is usually conducted annually.
timeline.examDate: Preliminary Exam: January 5, 6, 11, 12, 2024. Main Exam: February 25 & March 4, 2024.
timeline.resultDate: The final result for the 2023-24 cycle is expected in June 2024.

stages.name: Stage 1: Preliminary Examination
stages.description: An online objective test of 100 marks with a duration of 1 hour (60 minutes), divided into three sections with separate timings. This stage is qualifying in nature.

stages.name: Stage 2: Main Examination
stages.description: An online objective test of 200 marks with 190 questions. The duration is 2 hours and 40 minutes (160 minutes) with sectional timings. Marks obtained in the Main exam are considered for the final merit list. There is no interview.

stages.name: Stage 3: Language Proficiency Test (LPT)
stages.description: Candidates who have not studied the specified opted local language in their 10th or 12th standard will be required to take this qualifying test after the Main exam.

examPattern.markingScheme: For both Preliminary and Main exams, 1/4th (or 0.25) of the mark assigned to a question will be deducted for each wrong answer.

syllabus.name: Preliminary Exam: Numerical Ability
topics: Arithmetic Word Problems (Percentage, Profit & Loss, Time & Work, etc.)

syllabus.name: Main Exam: Reasoning Ability & Computer Aptitude
